meanings.definition: To be deprived of or cease to have possession of something.
meanings.sent1: She loses her favorite toy in the park.
meanings.sent2: He loses his keys often and has to search for them.
meanings.sent3: The magician loses his wand during the trick.
meanings.sent4: The explorer loses his way in the dense jungle.
meanings.sent5: The student loses her pencil in the classroom chaos.

meanings.definition: To fail to win a game, competition, or battle.
meanings.sent1: The team loses the soccer match by one goal.
meanings.sent2: She loses at chess but enjoys playing the game.
meanings.sent3: The cat loses the race against the squirrel in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The knight loses the jousting tournament to his rival.
meanings.sent5: He loses the card game but laughs at his bad luck.

meanings.sent1: The company loses money during the economic downturn.
meanings.sent2: She loses the argument but gracefully accepts the outcome.
meanings.sent3: The superhero loses the battle against the supervillain.
meanings.sent4: The army loses the war but never gives up hope.
meanings.sent5: He loses the bet but learns a valuable lesson.
